Develop a personalized "task completion playlist": Create a playlist of motivational songs that inspire you to tackle your tasks with renewed energy and focus. Whenever you feel the green-eyed monster creeping in, put on your playlist and let the music guide you to finish your tasks with ease.

Set "task completion challenges" with friends: Invite your friends to join you in a friendly competition to see who can complete their tasks the fastest. This will not only provide an added motivation but also give you a sense of camaraderie and accountability.

Create a "task completion journal": Start a journal where you track your progress and note down the tasks you complete each day. Seeing your progress in black and white can help you feel a sense of accomplishment and satisfaction, which can help curb jealousy.

Turn tasks into a game: Gamify your tasks by creating a points system or a reward system. Give yourself points or rewards for each task you complete, and watch your productivity soar. The sense of accomplishment and satisfaction you'll feel will help you stay focused and motivated.

Practice "gratitude and reflection": Take a few minutes each day to reflect on what you're grateful for and what you've accomplished. Focusing on the positive aspects of your life and the tasks you've completed can help shift your mindset and reduce feelings of jealousy.
